intro: Luzula rostrata, commonly known as the rostrated woodrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Plantaginaceae. It is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including parts of Europe, Asia, and North America. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It features dense clusters of grass-like leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers in late spring to early summer. Luzula rostrata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in stabilizing soil in wetland habitats.
